meanings.definition: A small, round, flexible ring used to fasten a scarf or neckerchief.
meanings.sent1: I lost my woggles while playing outside.
meanings.sent2: She wore a colorful woggles with her uniform.
meanings.sent3: The woggles slipped off and got lost in the grass.
meanings.sent4: The woggles held the scarf in place like a tiny guardian.
meanings.sent5: The shiny woggles sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a woggle.
meanings.sent1: He woggles his neckerchief tightly before the hike.
meanings.sent2: Please woggles the scarf so it doesn't fall off.
meanings.sent3: She woggles the woggle with a quick twist.
meanings.sent4: The woggle woggles the fabric securely in place.
meanings.sent5: You can woggles the ends together to keep it secure.

meanings.definition: The act of using a woggle to secure something in place.
meanings.sent1: The woggles of the scarf kept it from flying away.
meanings.sent2: His woggles of the neckerchief were always neat.
meanings.sent3: She demonstrated the proper woggles technique to the scouts.
meanings.sent4: The woggles of the woggle were intricate and colorful.
meanings.sent5: The woggles of the woggle were essential for the uniform.
